## Netgrep.searchBatchWithCallback() method

Execute the `search` method in batch for multiple files. This method takes a callback as an input and executes it everytime a match happens.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
searchBatchWithCallback<T extends object>(inputs: Array<NetgrepInput<T>>, pattern: string, cb: (result: BatchNetgrepResult<T>) => void, config?: NetgrepSearchConfig): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  inputs | Array&lt;[NetgrepInput](./netgrep.netgrepinput.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;&gt; |  |
|  pattern | string | The pattern to search for. This can be anything <code>ripgrep</code> can understand. |
|  cb | (result: [BatchNetgrepResult](./netgrep.batchnetgrepresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;) =&gt; void | The callback that will be triggered at every match. It takes a <code>BatchNetgrepResult&lt;T&gt;</code> as a parameter. |
|  config | [NetgrepSearchConfig](./netgrep.netgrepsearchconfig.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> An optional configuration respecting the <code>NetgrepSearchConfig</code> type. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
